text.p: World Cup holders Pakistan failed to reach the final of their golden jubilee tournament on Thursday.
They drew 3-3 with Germany and could only finish third behind them and the Netherlands in the five-nation event.
Pakistan, with draws from their two other games, only avoided defeat when Kamran Ashraf equalised a minute from time.
Tahir Zaman and Muhammad Shahbaz had put the hosts 2-0 ahead but Germany replied through Bjorn Michel, Oliver Domke and Kai Hollensteiner between the 30th and 49th minutes.
Tahir crucially failed to convert a second Pakistan penalty in the 55th minute and it was left to Ashraf to save the game by deflecting in a corner shot by Shahbaz.
Australia also recoverd from a two-goal deficit to beat England 5-2 and leave them bottom of the standings.
Russell Garcia and Bob Crutchley scored for England in the first 13 minutes, but Australia led 3-2 at the interval with goals by Matthew Smith and Jay Stacy.
Australian captain Stacy completed his hat-trick with his second corner goal in the 62nd minute.
With England over-committed, Australia broke for James Elmer to snatch the fifth.
